headlines.description: — Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins proved too hot to handle for the best defense in the Premier League as he scored two goals and set up another in a 3-0 win over Newcastle on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Watkins scores 2 more, Villa beats Newcastle 3-0 in EPL

headlines.description: — Frank Lampard’s disappointing start to his second spell as Chelsea manager continued as the team lost 2-1 at home to Brighton in the Premier League on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lampard's Chelsea loses again as Brighton rallies to win 2-1

headlines.description: Harry Wilson scored his first Premier League goal of the season as Fulham snapped a five-game losing run to win 3-1 at Everton on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Everton's relegation woes grow with loss to Fulham

headlines.description: — Eberechi Eze scored twice and resurgent Crystal Palace beat last-place Southampton 2-0 on Saturday in the Premier League for its third straight victory since the return of manager Roy Hodgson.
headlines.shortLinkText: Eze scores twice as resurgent Palace beats Southampton 2-0

headlines.description: Diego Costa netted his first goal for Wolverhampton Wanderers, getting on the scoresheet in the first half of a 2-0 win over Brentford.
headlines.shortLinkText: Costa grabs 1st Wolves goal in win over Brentford

headlines.description: — Tottenham's hopes of qualifying for the Champions League were dented after a 3-2 loss to Bournemouth following Dango Ouattara’s stoppage-time winner on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Tottenham's top-4 hopes hit with 3-2 EPL loss to Bournemouth

headlines.description: Erling Haaland netted a first-half brace to equal Mohamed Salah's single-season goal-scoring record in Manchester City's 3-1 victory over Leicester.
headlines.shortLinkText: Haaland equals PL record as City beat Leicester
